what_learn: What you will learn? Business Fundamentals: Acquire a solid understanding of core business principles, providing a foundational knowledge of organizational dynamics, operations, and strategy. Entrepreneurship: Develop skills and insights necessary for entrepreneurship, including business launch and effective management, fostering a mindset for innovation and risk-taking. Management Specialization: Choose a functional area of management to specialize in, tailoring the learning experience to align with specific career aspirations and industry demands. Team Collaboration: Cultivate the ability to work seamlessly in teams, recognizing the importance of collaborative efforts in achieving organizational goals and navigating professional environments.
modules: Modules Management and Behavioural Process Financial Accounting Business Mathematics Year 1 Multi-Disciplinary Course (Non Commerce/Management Course) Financial Management Marketing Management Foundations of Managerial Effectiveness Cost and Management Accounting Human Resource Management Business Ethics and Corporate Governance Multi-Disciplinary Course (Non Commerce/Management Course from SWAYAM) Skill Enhancement Course Year 2 Statistics and Research Methodology Entrepreneurship Development Introduction to Business Analytics Innovation and Creativity in Business Taxation Laws Strategic Management Internship Project Management Control System Global Business Finance Year 3 Business Laws Production and Operations Management Taxation Management Corporate Restructuring Management theory and Practice Business research methods Quantitative Research Business Strategy Year 4 Qualitative research Business Simulation Interdisciplinary Course
career: Career prospects Business Analyst: Analyse market trends, financial data, and operational metrics to provide valuable insights, aiding strategic decision-making for organizations. Entrepreneur: Launch and manage your own business ventures, applying the entrepreneurial skills and knowledge acquired during the BBA Honours program. Marketing Manager: Develop and implement effective marketing strategies, utilizing a comprehensive understanding of consumer behaviour and market dynamics. Human Resources Specialist: Manage personnel, recruitment, and employee relations, contributing to the development of a positive and productive work environment. Financial Consultant: Provide financial advice and analysis to individuals or businesses, leveraging a strong foundation in financial principles gained from the BBA Honours program.
